titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Student Institutional Memory Initiative (SIMI) records, 2017-2018 UA.31.08.0012
titlestmt.author: Laurin Penland

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-10-07 11:51:11 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Duke University. Student Institutional Memory Initiative

did.abstract: The Student Institutional Memory Initiative (SIMI) was a student group co-founded by Philip Moss in 2017. The purpose of the group was to document and preserve the experiences and stories of student activists at Duke. The records include member notes, a mission statement, goals, documents related to an oral history project, and meeting minutes and agendas.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access note. Collection contains electronic records that must be requested and accessed in our reading room. Contact Research Services with questions.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Student Institutional Memory Initiative (SIMI) records were received by the University Archives as a gift in 2018.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Student Institutional Memory Initiative (SIMI) was a student group co-founded by Philip Moss in 2017. The purpose of the group was to document and preserve the experiences and stories of student activists at Duke.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item],Student Institutional Memory Initiative (SIMI) Records, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Matthew Farrell and Laurin Penland, August 2020. Accessions in this guide include: UA2018-0014.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records include member notes, a mission statement, goals, documents related to an oral history project, and meeting minutes and agendas.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Word documents that include: drafts of a mission statement; list of priorities and organizations to contact; notes for oral histories project.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Word document files for regular SIMI meetings, a meeting to plan oral histories, and a working group meeting for contributing to Duke's "Disorientation Guide".
